course.subject: CIVL
course.name: BIM and Digital Construction
course.description: This course covers the principles and applications of information technology for construction management. Topics include building information modeling, database management and implementation, web-based communication and project management technologies, decision support systems, knowledge management, and data processing and analysis.

reviews.author: Kellyccw
reviews.title: A+ Good Grade PG Research-Type Course
reviews.comment_content:
Procedure for BIM and Dynamo, etc.
With theory PPT.  
I didn't pay much attention to the class if it is not related to my FYP/ Project.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Many info is given. Even BIM competition/ visit.
3 hours lesson, providing rest time.
reviews.comment_grading:
You will get A+ if you find a responsible groupmate for your project.
Jack mentioned it will be a good grade course.
PG students will take the quota first for this course but there were only around 10 PGs.
30 pages Group Project Report, 8-10min Presentation.
Very good civil elective to choose.
reviews.comment_workload:
Find some full days to work on it.  It will be easy to manage.
HW1: 10 hours at most for doing a BIM model. Easy and fun when you do this with your fds.
HW2: have source. Q&A. related to the PPT taught in class
Research Project: just need to find 4 people forming a group and one of them is FYP student of Jack.  I just need to help him/her to do the FYP.  They will know how to start doing it.  Push yourself to start doing it and it will be fine.  I have 5 people in my group.

reviews.author: Blando
reviews.title: Review
reviews.comment_content: Good, you will learn different modelling softwares and benifit a lot.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good and clear, it is very easy for you to learn softwares follow the instruction during class.
reviews.comment_grading: Very Good. try your best to do the final project, the grading will be much acceptable.
reviews.comment_workload:
Easy. You may finish most of your work during class time. There are 3 assignments during the first several weeks and they are very easy to be done if you focus on the lectures and follow the instruction.
Meanwhile, you have to visit CIC at least once.
you have to try your best and contribute to the final project which will be the most difficult and tough one for you.

reviews.author: 1a2s3d4f
reviews.title: recommended course
reviews.comment_content:
there are software tutorials regarding the following:
Basics and Practice (Revit)
Practice (Revit, Dynamo, Navisworks)
SQL
We were required to submit some of the software outputs as part of the in-class activities

We were also encouraged to visit CIC i-Hub (CITAC / CIC BIM SPACE / CIC MiC Resources
Center)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Although some of the class hours were devoted to software tutorials (which i greatly appreciated),
the bulk of the class hours were spent on lectures.
The class was scheduled at night so i think that's part of why i did not fully appreciate all the topics discussed in class.
Overall, i think the professor is great at teaching this course because he obviously knows what he is talking about.
reviews.comment_grading:
The professor is generous in giving grades.
The whole class received in incomplete grade at first because prof got covid, but the final grades were submitted before the next semester started so everything's good.
The professor understands that some PG students are extremely busy conducting experiments/analysis for their research and I think that is the reason why he's more lenient towards PG students.
reviews.comment_workload:
3 assignments
1 group project proposal
1 group project progress report
1 group project presentation
1 group project final report

I think the weight of the workload mainly depends on how willing your groupmates are to contribute to the project. If the tasks are divided equally among the group members, the workload will become relatively light. So choose groupmates with good work ethic (because you don't want to end up being the only one stressing about the project lol). Thankfully, I enjoyed working with my groupmates and we all had equal contributions to the project.

reviews.author: HALOHALOHALO
reviews.title: Construction Information Technology
reviews.comment_content:
1. dont expect you could get a good command of Revit after this course (but it can help)
2. the content is not mainly about how to use Revit to draw.
3. many related softwares are introduced. e.g. Dynamo
reviews.comment_teaching:
1. Prof is keen on teaching
2. TAs are too busy. hv no time to reply to emails. (you still need to send email to them before you ask help from Prof)
3. if you need some suggestions about the scope of the projects, it is good to ask Prof.
4. our performance on presentation is far from satisfactory. i think report is more important.


About report:
a) all data should be retrieved from reliable sources or calculation. (you should submit the Excel file)
b) make good assumption and give reasons. (tell why you design the model in that way?)
c)  it's better to ask Prof to give some advice on the scope of the project
d) when it comes to results, validation is very important. the result makes sense? why you know it does make sense? you should explain it by showing data and some articles.
e) limitations are also important. They are mainly caused by inability of software/hardware and
lack of data.
reviews.comment_grading:
"Class Participation  =  5%
Assignments =  40%
Class Project =  55% (4 people in a group) "

Most groups have five ppl while my group only hv 3(including myself)....

I got A+. because we make efforts. none of us can get 1st hon

the class project is so chur...actually we wrote about 40 pages and designed 8 models. Further info. is provided in TEACHING.
reviews.comment_workload:

As for workload:

2. One of my grpmates is very lazy but he is not a freerider haha
3. Capstone very chur. this project also chur. I think the report is like a small FYP.

reviews.author: Howie001
reviews.title: Recommend
reviews.comment_content: This course cover a wide range of smart construction at an introductory level. It also teaches some tools such as Revit and Dynamo. Some data formats as well.
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof has a lot of passion. You can ask him any related questions and he is glad to give you some useful advice.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is good. Prof is nice.
reviews.comment_workload: Several assignments, including Revit modelling, understanding of some basic concepts, etc. They would not take you much time. The workload of this course is fine. Don't worry about it.
